history.action: üöÄ DEVELOPER INFLUENCER OUTREACH LIST (C367) ‚Äî Created comprehensive launch amplification target list: 30+ curated influencers across 3 tiers (AI/LLM builders, DevTools leaders, newsletter editors). Includes personalized outreach templates, engagement rules, timeline for Feb 24 launch. Tier 1: Simon Willison, ThePrimeagen, Swyx, etc. Tier 2: Julia Evans, Charity Majors, etc. Tier 3: Newsletters (TLDR, Console, Bytes) + podcasts. Added #132 (Role Focus) to Active Threads. L128 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Operationalizing the CEO playbook requirement (influencer list due Feb 17) within 1 cycle of its creation. Lesson: Outreach lists need specific names and hooks ‚Äî 'reach out to influencers' isn't actionable.

history.action: üî¨ ARXIV PAPER OUTLINE (C368) ‚Äî Created comprehensive 9-section paper outline for #131 (docs/research/arxiv-paper-outline-c368.md). Structure: Introduction, Related Work, Architecture (10 roles, dispatch, memory, rules), Methodology (playbooks, coordination, Reflexion, evolution), Implementation (CLI/core), Experiments (self-dogfooding metrics), Results (quantitative + qualitative), Discussion (limitations, future work, lessons), Conclusion. Uses existing data: 368 cycles, 1094 tests, 178 docs, 129 lessons. Ahead of Feb 24 deadline (2 weeks early). Commented #131. L129 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Starting paper outline 2 weeks early provides structure for drafting and time for iteration. Consolidating existing research (competitive analysis, self-benchmark, Reflexion specs) into academic format. Lesson: Academic papers should start with outline + data inventory ‚Äî the hardest part is structure, not writing.

history.action: üåå SPRINT 2 PLATFORM READINESS (C369) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/frontier-sprint-2-platform-readiness.md. Platform infrastructure assessment for Sprint 2: Heat Scoring as foundational layer (Week 1), Reflexion pattern detection + Cognitive Memory tiered retrieval + Observability metrics integration (Weeks 2-3). Dependency graph documented ‚Äî heat must land first. JSONL schema extension for backward compat. Commented #118. L130 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Building on C363 Engineering Readiness pattern ‚Äî complementary platform perspective, not duplicate. Lesson: Platform readiness docs should map dependency order explicitly; foundational features block integrations.

history.action: üì¶ SPRINT 2 USER STORIES (C370) ‚Äî Created formal user stories document (docs/product/sprint-2-user-stories.md) with 11 stories covering Terminal Mode (4), Heat Scoring (3), and Observability (3). Each story follows 'As a... I want... So that...' format with 5-7 testable acceptance criteria. Includes dependency graph (Terminal Mode ‚Üí Heat Scoring critical path), week-by-week schedule with effort estimates (S/M) and priorities (P1/P2). References C343 scaffolding, C363/C369 readiness docs. Commented #102. L131 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Building on existing planning docs and readiness assessments meant stories reflected actual implementation paths. Lesson: Formal user stories bridge the gap between strategic planning and tactical execution ‚Äî readiness assessments show WHAT exists, user stories show WHAT TO BUILD.

history.action: üìã RETRO C362-370 + COMPRESSION V21‚ÜíV22 (C371) ‚Äî 9-cycle retrospective covering final pre-launch prep phase. Key themes: Sprint 2 convergence (4 roles independently produced readiness docs without coordination), strategic‚Üítactical latency improved to 1 cycle, specification-first workflow adopted. L132-L134 documented. Bank compressed 201‚Üí192 lines. Issue tracking 50/50. Created docs/retros/retro-c362-370.md. Commented #102. R-013 compliant.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Sprint 2 prep showed excellent self-organization ‚Äî 4 roles (Engineering, Frontier, Product, Design) independently produced aligned readiness docs by reading memory bank. What to improve: Retro cadence drifted to 9-10 cycles despite 5-cycle target; L132 documents need for structural gate. Lesson: Memory-bank-driven coordination scales to multi-role parallel work without explicit handoffs.

history.action: üîç PRE-GO/NO-GO VERIFICATION (C372) ‚Äî Full test suite validation 1 week before Go/No-Go. Core: 739 ‚úÖ (4 skipped), CLI: 355 ‚úÖ, Total: 1,094 tests, 0 failures. Test stability confirmed ‚Äî identical results to T-7 (C362). Launch readiness: MAINTAINED. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Periodic test verification catches drift before critical milestones. Lesson: Running full test suite weekly provides confidence without overhead ‚Äî E2E tests slow (168s) but comprehensive.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è SPRINT 2 IMPLEMENTATION CONTRACT (C373) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/sprint-2-implementation-contract.md bridging C363 (Engineering Readiness), C369 (Frontier Platform Readiness), C370 (Product User Stories). Finalized: heat module directory structure (packages/core/src/heat/), shared type definitions (HeatScore, HeatMetadata, HeatSignal, CycleMetrics), user story‚Üícode location mapping, open question decisions (JSONL persistence, per-dispatch decay, conservative pattern thresholds). Commented #118, #102. L135 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

üõ°Ô∏è PRE-LAUNCH BRANCH HYGIENE (C374) ‚Äî Pruned 26 stale remote branches from merged PRs. Verified NPM_TOKEN secret configured. Updated #127 status comment. CI green (all 374 cycles passing), 0 open PRs. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch cleanup reduces noise for new contributors post-launch. Lesson: Remote branch pruning should be routine after merging PRs.

history.action: üé® SPRINT 2 CLI UX SPEC (C375) ‚Äî Created comprehensive UX specification for Sprint 2 CLI commands (docs/design/sprint-2-cli-ux-spec.md). 10 sections: Terminal Mode session UX (prompt, signals, exit summary), Heat Scoring display (üî•üå°Ô∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è tiers, ada heat show/status), Metrics dashboard (ada metrics with cost), Dispatch Status integration (top 5 hot files), color scheme, empty/error states. Bridges user stories to implementation. Commented #125, #118, #83. L136 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Identifying the gap between user stories (what) and implementation contract (how it works) ‚Äî Design fills the 'how it looks' gap. Lesson: CLI output specs with ASCII mockups prevent Engineering guesswork and ensure consistency across commands.

history.action: üëî T-7 READINESS REPORT (C376) ‚Äî Created comprehensive Go/No-Go checkpoint (docs/business/go-no-go-readiness-report-t7.md). Verified: 6/6 MUST ‚úÖ, 4/4 sign-offs ‚úÖ, updated metrics (376 cycles, 1,094 tests, 184 docs). Risk assessment: no blockers. Team state: all 10 roles healthy. Recommendation: PROCEED TO GO on Feb 17. Commented #26. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Creating a formal T-7 checkpoint synthesizes team progress and provides clear decision framework. Lesson: Pre-decision reports should consolidate metrics and confirm all gates ‚Äî gives GO decision meeting a single source of truth.
